snippet: Growth in Germany in the second quarter was not strong enough to compensate for persistent recession in Spain and Italy, data released on Tuesday showed.
abstract: Data shows that the economy in the euro zone officially shifted to contraction from stagnation in the second quarter of 2012, portending a recession for the region later in the year that may put more pressure on political leaders struggling to keep the common currency intact.

byline.contributor: David Jolly contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Growth in Germany in the second quarter was not strong enough to compensate for persistent recession in Spain and Italy, data released on Tuesday showed.

headline.seo: Euro Zone Shifted to Contraction From Stagnation in 2nd Quarter
headline.main: No Longer Stagnating, Euro Zone Contracts
headline.print_headline: No Longer Stagnating, Euro Zone Contracts
